game.engine.image.sprite

Interface Sprite

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    BufferedSprite, ColoredSprite, DefaultSprite, DerivedSprite, InvertedSprite, WeakSprite

    public interface Sprite
    A sprite is an image that contains an array of smaller images (tiles). This images can be accessed like a normal Java array (and animated). But that this works, it is necessary that all tiles have the same size. Overlaying a grid of the dimensions of one frame marks all tiles. Even the space (if any exists) between the tiles has to be equal everywhere in the sprite, even at the edges of the sprite or tiles will be missed.
    Author:
    Marvin Bruns

    • Method Detail

      • drawTile

        void drawTile(java.awt.Graphics2D g,
            int x,
            int y,
            int width,
            int height)
        Draws a tile of this sprite. The tile is drawn with Bounds(0, 0, width, height). Consider creating a clipped Graphics2D object.
        Parameters:
        g - Graphics2D object to draw on
        x - X-Coordinate of the tile
        y - Y-Coordinate of the tile
        width - The width of the Graphics object to draw on
        height - The height of the Graphics object to draw on

      • getTile

        java.awt.image.BufferedImage getTile(int x,
                                   int y)
        Get a tile of this sprite. Be careful with this method. Creates a copy of the underlying tile.
        Use drawTile(Graphics2D, int, int, int, int) for faster action and less memory usage.
        Parameters:
        x - X-Coordinate of the tile
        y - Y-Coordinate of the tile
        Returns:
        A BufferedImage containing the tile

      • getTileCount

        int getTileCount()
        Get the number of tiles in this sprite.

      • getRows

        int getRows()
        Get the number of rows.

      • getColumns

        int getColumns()
        Get the number of columns.

      • getTileWidth

        int getTileWidth()
        Get the width of one tile

      • getTileHeight

        int getTileHeight()
        Get the height of one tile

      • getSubSprite

        Sprite getSubSprite(int x,
                  int y,
                  int width,
                  int height)
        Get sub-sprite with given dimension. The returned DerivedSprite is linked with this sprite.
        Parameters:
        x - X-Coordinate of first tile
        y - Y-Coordinate of first tile
        width - Width of the sub-sprite
        height - Height of the sub-sprite
        Returns:
        The sub-sprite in form of a DerivedSprite
